results.title: Kitty Spit
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Kate Van Egmond
results.brief_description: Cat, Violet and Melody are Kitty Spit, a 3-piece band ready for good times and rock ‘n roll. However, Violet has broken up with her boyfriend and seems inconsolable. Cat and Melody do all they can to cheer her up, but will she ever be happy again? Girls, guitars and heartache - it’s what keeps them together.

results.title: Kitty and the cartwheelers' shopping jeep bonanza [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Teetotum Pictures, Film Victoria. Independent Film-makers' Fund, Pia Abrahams and Michaela French
results.brief_description: This clever ‘mockumentry’ profiles a large range of shoppers and their affectionate relationship with that all-Australian icon: the shopping jeep. Using the South Melbourne market and Station Pier as a background, director Michaela French reveals the many faces of this Australian icon, from traditional brown vinyl to fully customable vehicle able to accommodate every usage and need, including pet limousine. Features an interview with a jeep manufacturer who enlightens the viewer as to the options available on the market, as well as interviews with jeep owners who describe how they have personalised the handy carrier.
results.title_for_label: Kitty and the cartwheelers’ shopping jeep bonanza [Widescreen]

results.title: Kitty and the bagman
results.creator_credit: Forest Home Films, Anthony Buckley and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: A drama about two of Sydney’s best known crime queens - Kitty O’Rourke and Big Lil - who created havoc in the underworld of the 1920’s. Together these two women ran the sly grog shops, gambling houses, prostitution and hold up merchants during the seamier side of 1920’s life in Australia. Stars Liddy Clark and John Stanton.

results.title: Kittens grow up
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Hugh Johnston and Suzanne Johnston
results.brief_description: Studies the development of kittens from immediately after birth, through learning to walk, until they gain the ability to co-ordinate all their activities. Also covers the role of the mother cat in this development. Sequal to ‘Kittens are born’. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Kittens are born
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Hugh Johnston and Suzanne Johnston
results.brief_description: Follows a female cat from pregnancy through labour and the birth of three kittens. Emphasises the birth process and parental care immediately following birth. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Kites: a collage of kites and kite flyers
results.creator_credit: Compass Films (UK), Arts Council of Great Britain, Peter R. Jones and Simon Heaven
results.brief_description: Shows kites soaring above city heights, wafting across scenic countryside and displaying an array of designs, shapes and multi-tiered constructions. Explores kite mechanics, traditional patterns and characteristics and scientific and other practical applications of these fanciful toys. Includes live footage of kite experiments and archival stills of similarly innovative attempts of the past.

results.title: Kite flying
results.creator_credit: David Waddington Productions, Australia Council and David Waddington
results.brief_description: Peter Travis sees kite-making as an art form and himself as a sculptor. The complex strings of geometric pieces that he assembles to form his large kites, he calls “flying colourfield geometric constructions”. Travis is shown flying his kites and talking about their making. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Kitchen sink
results.creator_credit: Hibiscus Films, Bridget Ikin and Alison MacLean
results.brief_description: Alison MacLean’s highly acclaimed first film, shot in stark black-and-white, is a wordless experimental horror/romance short about a women who gets much more than she bargains for when she dislodges a rope of hair from the bowels of her kitchen sink. A darkly humorous, tender and disturbing love story about abject female desire that evokes elements of the Frankenstein story. The film competed at Cannes in 1989 and won eight international awards.
